metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1146 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The mem_cgroup_usage_unregister_event function in mm/memcontrol.c in theLinux kernel before 3.2.10 does not properly handle multiple events thatare attached to the same eventfd, which allows local users to cause adenial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact by registering memory threshold events.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.4.0-4-goldfish - 3.4.0-4.27
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-7-mako - 3.4.0-7.40
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-5-flo - 3.4.0-5.22
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
